de.esoco.lib.collection

Class CacheMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,V>
          • de.esoco.lib.collection.CacheMap<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<K,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReferenceCacheMap

    public class CacheMap<K,V>
extends java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,V>
    A subclass of linked hash map that implements a cache of a fixed size. It uses the constructor LinkedHashMap.LinkedHashMap(int, float, boolean) to create an access-ordered map. The maximum capacity of the cache is enforced by overriding the method LinkedHashMap.removeEldestEntry(java.util.Map.Entry). If the capacity is exceeded while adding a new entry the eldest (i.e. least recently accessed) entry will be removed from the cache.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of this cache map. If a new entry is added to the cache and the capacity is exceeded the oldest entry will be removed from the cache.
        Returns:
        The capacity

      • removeEldest

        public java.util.Map.Entry<K,V> removeEldest()
        Removes the eldest entry from this cache map and returns it.
        Returns:
        The removed entry or NULL if this map is empty

      • setCapacity

        public void setCapacity(int nNewCapacity)
        Sets the capacity of this instance. If the capacity is decreased below the current size of this instance the oldest entries will be removed.
        Parameters:
        nNewCapacity - The new capacity
